title: Weather education for a Weather-Ready Nation
content:
Wherever you live in the United States, thereâ€™s a National Weather Service (NWS) forecast office near you. With over 160 local, regional, and national offices across the country, NWS experts are not only responsible for forecasting the weather, they also have opportunities to share their love of weather through local education and outreach. Whether talking with school children, leading storm spotter classes, or hosting student volunteers, each opportunity can be tailored to their community. Here, we share a window into weather forecast offices for a look at weather education across the nation.
